data.title: Panic: Server 2003 - can't join domain, specified name no longer available
data.text:
Windows Server 2003 running payroll didn’t recover from a reboot today. At some point, we disjoined from the domain and tried to rejoin. Now we get

The following error occurred attempting to join the domain xxxxx

The specified network name is no longer available.

IP is good. Connectivity is good. Can see DCs and, when tried, get DHCP from them.

DNS points to good servers. Servers return valid IPs for other machines.

Tried deleting PC from AD. Tried recreating record.

Tried joining domain under a different name. No good.

Tried removing/rejoining other PCs. No problem.

Recent changes since last reboot: demoted an old DC in the same site and removed its DNS and DFS roles.

The 2003 server in question is a simple setup with file sharing and runs a light app that uses MSSQL.

Scoured the net to no avail. Any help is welcome.

@Microsoft

You said DNS is good, but is it using your internal DCs for DNS? If no, make it so, If yes try joining the domain by using a DCs IP address - this if it works indicates a DNS issue.

Why is a server using DHCP anyway?

Can you connect to \IPaddressofDC\admin$ - are you prompted for credentials?

Backups: I have the data backed up. But, of course, the restore program is on the server. It’s an old copy of CA Backup. We’re re-installing that now so we can recover the files.

The system as a whole isn’t backed up to the point where I could do a bare-metal restore. It’s a legacy system and we were in the process of trying to unwind ourselves from it. It ran everything.

Event viewer isn’t showing any error that appears to be directly related to the attempt to join.

Yes, it’s using the internal DC for DNS. It uses a fixed IP, but we tried DHCP to verify that it could talk to the server at all. It’s back on fixed.

Tried to map a drive to \10.40.8.1\admin$

Error = The mapped network drive could not be created because…The specified network name is no longer available.

From the server, I can ping 10.40.8.19 and 10.40.8.29 (DCs) both by IP and name. But I cannot browse to them.

the NIC has DNS set to 10.40.8.19 and 10.40.8.29.

Tried changing the nic dns to 10.30.8.19 and 10.30.8.29. Join domain failed.
